TopicTitle: Should capsules have RCS thrusters built-in?

Articles.Content:
A lot of the capsules in KSP have what look like thruster ports in their textures. Should they have working RCS thrusters built in?

Note: This doesn't apply to all capsules, just the ones with the textured ports.

My first reaction is no. RCS aren't like reaction wheels in the sense that can be placed anywhere and still work. Having a bunch of RCS ports that have their position fixed will make placing the rest of the vessel's RCS ports more complicated.
Yes, the should. Regarding the existing ports screwing things up, have the ability to turn them off for the pod, problem solved.

> 
> have the ability to turn them off for the pod, problem solved.

Here is another way of solving the problem: don't assume that the texture that the artist put in a pod is meant to be a RCS port.
They are obviously RCS ports, I'd suggest fixing the textures, they'd be easy to remove. Then rcs blocks could be added, perhaps as decals for pods?

> 
> They are obviously RCS ports

Which ones? the ones in Porkjet's mk2 cockpits? porkjet said that those [aren't RCS ports](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/57662-PorkWorks-dev-thread-Habitat-Pack-SpaceplanePlus?p=1120335&viewfull=1#post1120335).

![190px-Mk1-2commandpod.png](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/w/images/thumb/a/ac/Mk1-2commandpod.png/190px-Mk1-2commandpod.png)

This one in particular.

> 
> Which ones? the ones in Porkjet's mk2 cockpits? porkjet said that those [aren't RCS ports](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/57662-PorkWorks-dev-thread-Habitat-Pack-SpaceplanePlus?p=1120335&viewfull=1#post1120335).

I've never looked much at them, I don't do spaceplanes.

I just looked at them, they certainly look like RCS jets on the mk2 as well. If not, what are they, exactly? There are 4 right under the windscreen, and they are symmetric. If they are instruments, what 4 are they?

> 
> [http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/w/images/thumb/a/ac/Mk1-2commandpod.png/190px-Mk1-2commandpod.png](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/w/images/thumb/a/ac/Mk1-2commandpod.png/190px-Mk1-2commandpod.png)
> This one in particular.

Those even have scorch marks.
It's not a question of should they. It's a question of can they. And the answer is no. the RCS module basically is bugged and RCS thrusters don't work correctly if they are a root part of a vessel.

stupid\_chris, is it possible to make a zero-thickness part that could be like the flags, but are in fact "inset" RCS parts? Then you could apply them to a capsule as a unique part. Perhaps they would be customized as 1.25m for the mk1, and 2.5 for the mk1-2? Maybe as a complete "ring" so that this one part would do for each (and they would be scaled to exactly fit those pods).

I'm inclined to cast my vote against pre-placed RCS thrusters, just because it reduces the flexibility of your designs - you probably don't want to mount surface-attached parts over a thruster port (even if it works anyway, grumble grumble). Having thruster ports user-placed is nice because you can build whatever ludicrous design you want and not have to worry about covering up anything that you can't move.
